briefTitle: A Study To Assess The Safety And Efficacy Of SU11248 In Patients With Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor(GIST)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Key Inclusion Criteria:

* Histologically-proven diagnosis of malignant GIST not amenable to surgery, radiation or combined modality treatment with curative intent
* Failed Gleevec treatment or intolerant to Gleevec therapy

Key Exclusion Criteria:

* Treatment with any chemotherapy, chemoembolization therapy, immunotherapy, or investigational agent since the last dose of Gleevec

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP) as Assessed by Imaging Studies at End of Double-blind Treatment Phase
outcomeMeasures.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression based on the assessment of an independent, third-party imaging laboratory using RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors).

outcomeMeasures.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause (on treatment or within 28 days of last dose).

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival Status of Subjects
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of subjects alive at end of study.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival Based on the Rank Preserving Structural Failure Time Method
outcomeMeasures.description: time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause (rank preserving structural failure time method).

outcomeMeasures.title: Best Overall Tumor Response During Double-blind Treatment Phase
outcomeMeasures.description: Tumor response according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST).

outcomeMeasures.title: Confirmed Objective Response (CR or PR) in Subjects
outcomeMeasures.description: Overall confirmed objective response = confirmed Complete Response (CR) OR confirmed Partial Response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed responses were those that persisted on repeat imaging study â‰¥ 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Tumor Response (TTR)
outcomeMeasures.description: Time from date of randomization to first documentation of objective tumor response that was subsequently confirmed. TTR was only calculated for the subgroup of subjects with a confirmed objective tumor response.

outcomeMeasures.title: Duration of Performance Status Maintenance
outcomeMeasures.description: Time from randomization until the last time the performance status was no worse than at baseline or to death due to cancer in the absence of previous documentation of performance status worsening.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP) as Assessed in the Double-blind Treatment Phase at End of Study
outcomeMeasures.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression based on the assessment of an independent, third-party imaging laboratory using RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors).

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Pain Progression Using McGill Pain Questionnaire-present Pain Intensity (MPQ-PPI)
outcomeMeasures.description: 25th Quartile: Time to Progression. Progression: a) No change (NC) in MPQ-PPI score (0=no pain to 5=excruciating pain) with increase total analgesic use \>= 50% over baseline OR b) Increase score \>= 1 point with either NC in total analgesic use or increase total analgesic use \>= 50% over baseline. (50th Quartile not achieved.)

outcomeMeasures.title: Subjects With Pain Relief Response Using McGill Pain Questionnaire-present Pain Intensity (MPQ-PPI)
outcomeMeasures.description: MPQ-PPI: 0=no pain to 5= excruciating pain. Pain Relief Response= 1) Decrease by \>= 1 points in MPQ-PPI score with either Decrease or No Change in total analgesic use \>= 50% over baseline OR 2) No change in MPQ-PPI score with Decrease total analgesic use \>= 50% over baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline Score in EuroQoL Visual Analog Scale (EQ-VAS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change: median score at observation minus median score at baseline. EQ-VAS score on the self-rated "thermometer," indicating the patient's own assessment of their health status from 0 (worst) to 100 (best) imaginable health state.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D Health State Profile Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Change: median index score at observation minus median index score at baseline. EQ-5D is a generic instrument that describes health status in 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression, usual activities) with a weighted health Index based on general population values where where 0.0 = death and 1.0 = perfect health.
